remarks.para: A buffer of doubles.

.method public static hidebysig class Java.Nio.DoubleBuffer Allocate(int32 capacity) cil managed

Docs.param: the capacity of the new buffer.
Docs.summary: Creates a double buffer based on a newly allocated double array.

remarks.para: Creates a double buffer based on a newly allocated double array.

Docs.exception: if capacity is less than zero.

MemberSignature.Value: public override sealed int ArrayOffset ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 ArrayOffset() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the offset into the array returned by array of the first element of the buffer (optional operation).

remarks.para: Returns the offset into the array returned by array of the first element of the buffer (optional operation). The backing array (if there is one) is not necessarily the same size as the buffer, and position 0 in the buffer is not necessarily the 0th element in the array. Use buffer.array()[offset + buffer.arrayOffset() to access element offset in buffer.
Use hasArray to ensure this method won't throw. (A separate call to isReadOnly is not necessary.)

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract Java.Nio.DoubleBuffer AsReadOnlyBuffer ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Java.Nio.DoubleBuffer AsReadOnlyBuffer() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a read-only buffer that shares its content with this buffer.

remarks.para: Returns a read-only buffer that shares its content with this buffer.
The returned buffer is guaranteed to be a new instance, even if this buffer is read-only itself. The new buffer's position, limit, capacity and mark are the same as this buffer's.
The new buffer shares its content with this buffer, which means that this buffer's change of content will be visible to the new buffer. The two buffer's position, limit and mark are independent.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract Java.Nio.DoubleBuffer Compact ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Java.Nio.DoubleBuffer Compact() cil managed

Docs.summary: Compacts this double buffer.

remarks.para: Compacts this double buffer.
The remaining doubles will be moved to the head of the buffer, staring from position zero. Then the position is set to remaining(); the limit is set to capacity; the mark is cleared.

Docs.exception: if no changes may be made to the contents of this buffer.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 CompareTo(class Java.Nio.DoubleBuffer otherBuffer) cil managed

Docs.param: another double buffer.
Docs.summary: Compare the remaining doubles of this buffer to another double buffer's remaining doubles.

remarks.para: Compare the remaining doubles of this buffer to another double buffer's remaining doubles.

Docs.exception: if other is not a double buffer.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract Java.Nio.DoubleBuffer Duplicate ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Java.Nio.DoubleBuffer Duplicate() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a duplicated buffer that shares its content with this buffer.

remarks.para: Returns a duplicated buffer that shares its content with this buffer.
The duplicated buffer's position, limit, capacity and mark are the same as this buffer's. The duplicated buffer's read-only property and byte order are the same as this buffer's, too.
The new buffer shares its content with this buffer, which means either buffer's change of content will be visible to the other. The two buffers' position, limit and mark are independent.

remarks.para: Returns the double at the current position and increases the position by 1.

Docs.exception: if the position is equal or greater than limit.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Java.Nio.DoubleBuffer Get (double[] dst);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Java.Nio.DoubleBuffer Get(float64[] dst) cil managed

Docs.param: the destination double array.
Docs.summary: Reads doubles from the current position into the specified double array and increases the position by the number of doubles read.

remarks.para: Reads doubles from the current position into the specified double array and increases the position by the number of doubles read.
Calling this method has the same effect as get(dst, 0, dst.length).

Docs.exception: if dst.length is greater than remaining().

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Java.Nio.DoubleBuffer Get (double[] dst, int dstOffset, int doubleCount);

Docs.param: the target double array.
the offset of the double array, must not be negative and not greater than dst.length.
the number of doubles to read, must be no less than zero and not greater than dst.length - dstOffset.
Docs.summary: Reads doubles from the current position into the specified double array, starting from the specified offset, and increases the position by the number of doubles read.

remarks.para: Reads doubles from the current position into the specified double array, starting from the specified offset, and increases the position by the number of doubles read.

Docs.exception: if either dstOffset or doubleCount is invalid.
if doubleCount is greater than remaining().

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool HasArray { get; }
.property instance bool HasArray

Docs.summary: Returns true if array and arrayOffset won't throw.

remarks.para: Returns true if array and arrayOffset won't throw. This method does not return true for buffers not backed by arrays because the other methods would throw UnsupportedOperationException, nor does it return true for buffers backed by read-only arrays, because the other methods would throw ReadOnlyBufferException.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract Java.Nio.ByteOrder Order ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Java.Nio.ByteOrder Order() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the byte order used by this buffer when converting doubles from/to bytes.

remarks.para: Returns the byte order used by this buffer when converting doubles from/to bytes.
If this buffer is not based on a byte buffer, then this always returns the platform's native byte order.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Java.Nio.DoubleBuffer Put (Java.Nio.DoubleBuffer src);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Java.Nio.DoubleBuffer Put(class Java.Nio.DoubleBuffer src) cil managed

Docs.param: the source double buffer.
Docs.summary: Writes all the remaining doubles of the src double buffer to this buffer's current position, and increases both buffers' position by the number of doubles copied.

remarks.para: Writes all the remaining doubles of the src double buffer to this buffer's current position, and increases both buffers' position by the number of doubles copied.

Docs.exception: if src.remaining() is greater than this buffer's remaining().
if src is this buffer.
if no changes may be made to the contents of this buffer.

if no changes may be made to the contents of this buffer.

MemberSignature.Value: public Java.Nio.DoubleBuffer Put (double[] src);
.method public hidebysig instance class Java.Nio.DoubleBuffer Put(float64[] src) cil managed

Docs.param: the source double array.
Docs.summary: Writes doubles from the given double array to the current position and increases the position by the number of doubles written.

remarks.para: Writes doubles from the given double array to the current position and increases the position by the number of doubles written.
Calling this method has the same effect as put(src, 0, src.length).

Docs.exception: if remaining() is less than src.length.
if no changes may be made to the contents of this buffer.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract Java.Nio.DoubleBuffer Slice ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Java.Nio.DoubleBuffer Slice() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a sliced buffer that shares its content with this buffer.

remarks.para: Returns a sliced buffer that shares its content with this buffer.

The sliced buffer's capacity will be this buffer's remaining(), and its zero position will correspond to this buffer's current position. The new buffer's position will be 0, limit will be its capacity, and its mark is cleared. The new buffer's read-only property and byte order are the same as this buffer's.
The new buffer shares its content with this buffer, which means either buffer's change of content will be visible to the other. The two buffers' position, limit and mark are independent.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override IntPtr ThresholdClass { get; }
.property instance native int ThresholdClass

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

MemberSignature.Value: protected override Type ThresholdType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type ThresholdType

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Java.Nio.DoubleBuffer Wrap (double[] array);
.method public static hidebysig class Java.Nio.DoubleBuffer Wrap(float64[] array) cil managed

Docs.param: the double array which the new buffer will be based on.
Docs.summary: Creates a new double buffer by wrapping the given double array.

remarks.para: Creates a new double buffer by wrapping the given double array.
Calling this method has the same effect as wrap(array, 0, array.length).

MemberSignature.Value: public static Java.Nio.DoubleBuffer Wrap (double[] array, int start, int doubleCount);
.method public static hidebysig class Java.Nio.DoubleBuffer Wrap(float64[] array, int32 start, int32 doubleCount) cil managed

Docs.param: the double array which the new buffer will be based on.
the start index, must not be negative and not greater than array.length.
the length, must not be negative and not greater than array.length - start.
Docs.summary: Creates a new double buffer by wrapping the given double array.

remarks.para: Creates a new double buffer by wrapping the given double array.
The new buffer's position will be start, limit will be start + doubleCount, capacity will be the length of the array.

Docs.exception: if either start or doubleCount is invalid.
